question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Constant: PrivateKey::AIP_80_PREFIX] [Prefix collision] Is the prefix 'bls12381-priv-' sufficiently unique from other AIP-80 prefixes to prevent accidental private key exposure in logs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Function: ValidCryptoMaterial::to_bytes()] [Allocation overhead] Does the Vec<u8> allocation for every serialization create performance bottlenecks or memory pressure under high load? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Constant: PublicKey::LENGTH] [Hardcoded constant] The LENGTH is hardcoded as 48 - if the blst library changes compression format, could this cause deserialization failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Constant: PrivateKey::LENGTH] [Hardcoded constant] The LENGTH is hardcoded as 32 - could future cryptographic upgrades requiring longer keys break backward compatibility? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Function: Debug for PublicKey] [Information leakage] Does hex encoding the full public key in Debug output create log pollution or expose validator identities unnecessarily? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Function: Display for PublicKey] [Information leakage] Does displaying the full public key enable fingerprinting or tracking of validators across different contexts? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Struct: PrivateKey] [Debug leakage prevention] The PrivateKey uses SilentDebug and SilentDisplay - are these protections sufficient to prevent accidental private key logging in all error paths? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Integration: PoP verification assumption] The entire security model assumes PoP verification happens before key aggregation - what happens if a developer forgets to verify PoPs and directly aggregates untrusted keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Integration: Deserialization safety] PublicKey deserialization doesn't subgroup-check - if a developer uses a deserialized key without PoP verification or manual subgroup check, can this enable rogue key attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Integration: Key lifecycle] Are there safeguards ensuring private keys are properly zeroized when dropped, or could they persist in memory after use enabling key extraction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Integration: Signature verification] While the file defines keys, actual signature verification happens elsewhere - are there consistency guarantees that verified signatures used the correct DST matching these keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Integration: Thread safety] Are PublicKey and PrivateKey structs Send/Sync safe for concurrent access across validator threads without race conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Integration: Backwards compatibility] If the blst library is updated to a newer version, could subtle changes in point encoding or validation break existing keys stored on-chain? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Edge case: Empty aggregation] What happens if PublicKey::aggregate() is called with an empty vector - does it return an error or produce an invalid identity key? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Edge case: Single key aggregation] If aggregate() is called with only one public key, is the result identical to the input key, or could aggregation introduce errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Edge case: Maximum aggregation] Is there a maximum number of keys that can be aggregated before hitting computational or memory limits causing validator crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Edge case: Duplicate aggregation] If the same key appears multiple times in aggregate(), does it get counted multiple times artificially inflating weight? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Edge case: Malformed bytes] What happens if TryFrom receives exactly LENGTH bytes but all zeros - is this a valid encoding or does it cause errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Edge case: Maximum value bytes] If TryFrom receives bytes representing the maximum field element value, does it properly handle reduction modulo the curve order? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Edge case: Generator key] Can an attacker use the curve generator point directly as a public key to exploit any special properties? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Crypto: Curve choice] Is BLS12-381 with min-pk variant the optimal choice, or could the min-sig variant provide better performance or security for Aptos use cases? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Crypto: Pairing security] Does the implementation properly handle pairing-based attacks like invalid curve attacks or twist attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Crypto: Hash-to-curve security] Is the hash-to-curve implementation (via DST) properly following the IETF BLS standard to prevent predictable point generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Crypto: Discrete log assumption] If quantum computers break discrete log, are there migration paths that don't require changing all validator keys simultaneously? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/bls12381_keys.rs] [Crypto: Cofactor clearing] Does the subgroup_check properly handle cofactor clearing to prevent small subgroup attacks on the twist? (High)
